website_summaries.verdict: A well-made model for an affordable price – the best choice if you want quality and a good deal.
pros: Combines a sturdy base and 22-inch post that's built to last
Covered with natural sisal that attracts cats to scratch
cons: Not a space-saving design like some others on our list

customer_reviews.title: A Kitty Pole Party
customer_reviews.text: Every one of my 7 adult cats used this within hours. Easy to put together and well priced. It is a multi purpose item so some took right to scratching it while others quickly noticed the marbles. It waa a party at the pole!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Kottler

customer_reviews.title: 4  different areas of play and scratch!
customer_reviews.text: Real easy to put together, in fact my six-year-old granddaughter did it on her own. My 2 1/2 month old kitty cat seems to love it! I like the fact that she is using her claws on something other than the furniture 😉
customer_reviews.author: missusms

customer_reviews.title: Fun scratch/play post
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun scratching and play post. I have now had this a month, and my cats love it! As you can tell, my cat loves the rope the best. The marbles are fun to watch the cats chase around. I sprayed catnip spray on the hanging ball on top, and they definitely loved that. The post is not very big, but it is good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Carson Teal

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: I have bought other scratching post in the past and this is by far the sturdiest. The marbles in the bottom do not make too much noise which is a plus, the cats love it. Wish I would have purchased it sooner to save my chair....
customer_reviews.author: C. Beck

customer_reviews.title: The kittens can't get enough of this!
customer_reviews.text: i just adopted 2 kittens and they cannot get enough of this, it's helping to save my furniture too by giving them a place to scratch. Easy to put together and a huge success with them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Langevin

customer_reviews.title: this scratch post is perfect! The interactive sections immediately caught their attention and ...
customer_reviews.text: We have two very energetic kittens, this scratch post is perfect! The interactive sections immediately caught their attention and by playing with them they realized scratching was an option too.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: I bought this cat scratching post for my lovely gray cat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cat scratching post for my lovely gray cat. He is quite big. My cat loves it. As soon as I collected it, he began plays with marble ball and sharpening claws on sisal rope. By the way, it’s very easy to assemble. Quality, at first glance, very good, pretty sturdy materials. One of the nicest item I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a hit😻
customer_reviews.text: ***update*** It’s still a nice scratcher the cats like it but every time I come home it’s laying on it’s side. It’s not heavy enough to stay upright with all the scratching. But we’ll keep it anyway. Nice scratcher, easy to assemble. Cats like chasing the little marbles. It’s height is up to my knees, I’d give it 5 stars if it were a bit taller. Satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Susie706

customer_reviews.title: Cat can stand and scratch (If it’s the size of a squirrel)
customer_reviews.text: It is not tall. For real-world reference, the cat on the photos must be about the size of a squirrel. My adult cats most certainly cannot stretch and scratch on this.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Tips over and cats not interested at all
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mainly for the bottom part with the marbles. Thought it would keep my cats interested. The marbles are so low in the track the only way they can move them is if their claws are out. So they are not amused at all with them unless I sit there and push them around every couple seconds. The post is actually kind of short too; and since the sisal is up on top, when my cats sit to scratch it, the whole thing tips over on them. The base needs to have much more weight in it to prevent it from tipping. I would definitely not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: cnkd5

customer_reviews.title: Forgo the tower, make more tracks with marbles
customer_reviews.text: The ball on the tower fell off after half a day (looked stapled in with office staples). The cats love playing with the marbles in track, but only the inner one moves, the outer track is too small and that ball gets stuck on a 1/4 of the track. They pretty much don't mess with the tower part since the ball fell off. Probably be a better toy if it was just a bunch of tracks and marbles, and the marbles actually went around the track without getting jammed. Not going to send it back, but definitely disappointed in the poor quality
customer_reviews.author: D Howard Jr

customer_reviews.title: Great product but marbles are too small!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this scratcher- it seems very sturdy and was easy to put together! The only reason I gave this 4 stars was because the balls at the bottom are marbles and can easily be swallowed by a cat which makes me really nervous. I will probably end up taking them out. Otherwise a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Sami Felcman

customer_reviews.title: Stuffing makes a mess!
customer_reviews.text: My kitties tore this apart within two days. The stuffing is all over the house. Also, it’s very unstable - fell over several times. I’m buying an all-sisal post and sending this back.
customer_reviews.author: Babzter

customer_reviews.title: Good Post But...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice scratching post and I would have given it 5 stars but it didn't have the accessories needed to put it together. It's supposed to come with a screw, etc., but nothing else was in the package. We worked around this by taking apart the old scratching post and using that screw. Once put together, my little boy cat loves looking at the marbles in the base. For some reason he finds them absolutely fascinating.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Girl

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: This scratching post is exactly what I needed. It doesn't take up too much room, but attracts the cats to scratch it instead of my speakers! The toy ball on the top was pulled off almost immediately, but I just tied it back on and it seems to be holding out ok. They scratch on it a lot and the beige rope hasn't started to deteriorate or come off yet. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Cats scratch it as intended
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace the old scratching post. This was is thinner, which I knew before buying. After reading reviews and selecting the perfect post, my cats just don't care about all the thought that was given into this purchase. They enjoyed the marbles in the beginning but are too lazy to play with them if I'm not pushing them around. They don't care about the pom pom on it. They're 8 years old and really just want to scratch it. I do like the wooden base, with or without the marbles, because it seems more sturdy. Overall does it's job, the cats scratch it as intended, they're just not as excited about the marbles as I was. lol
customer_reviews.author: Danielle G

customer_reviews.title: My Kittens Love It
customer_reviews.text: I just got two 8 month old kittens so I tried this to help train them to stay away from my furniture. They were already scratching on it as I assembled it, which BTW is a very easy. Needless to say, they love it and so far no scratching on any furniture. It's been about a month now, so an excellent trend going thanks to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K.

customer_reviews.title: Good Scratcher but Mediocre overall quality
customer_reviews.text: The base isn't heavy enough to keep it standing. Overall the scratcher is a good quality but my cat knocks it over easily and he's still a kitten. He also already tore the ball off after only two weeks and he's never managed that with any of the other items we have with similar decals. The marbles in the base are a nice touch and they are secure even when the base is tipped over.
customer_reviews.author: G. Keeper

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves this! I’ve had it for over 5 months now and she still scratches on it everyday. The white rope bit is very sturdy, you can see in the second picture that after 5 months, it is barely fraying. The brown fuzzy section had started to come off quite a bit from scratching though. My cat also likes the marble feature, and will still push them around every now and again months later. The assembly was the easiest thing to do too! Would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Z_Ripa

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and my cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: Scratching post is very well-made with high quality materials, and although it is a simple object, some thought has clearly been put into its design. The base is nice and heavy, and came with four rubber feet to protect my floor. The tracks that the balls are in are made in such a way that it is impossible for the ball to come out, so there is no danger to my kitties. They love playing with the furry puffball that hangs from the top. My kitten will take a running jump and attach himself to the post and play with the puffball.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Decent scratching post
customer_reviews.text: This does the job at a decent price. We get a new cat scratch post every tome our cat wears the old one out (every 6 months or so). This one was a good deal and I liked the added element of the marble-like balls in the base as an activity for my cat. She took to the post right away, doesn’t bother with the marble balls after all, it the post is good for her. The only thing is because it’s light overall, as she’s scratching the whole base lifts up and hit the ground causing a loud noise and also rattling the marbles.
customer_reviews.author: GumballWizard

customer_reviews.title: Captivating
customer_reviews.text: Better than the fact I love it is that my cat loves it. I had not realized the marble "game" at the base. He absolutely LOVES it and initially played for at least 30 minutes. Still goes back to it. Overall it's quite sturdy and he does his scratching thing on it. It's easy to recommend this and yes, I would reorder. - I have another post too and I think I'll start switching them out so to help keep their interest. - I should mention it is very, very easy to assemble - 2 minutes, even with my feline's assistance.
customer_reviews.author: AKOS

customer_reviews.title: Base is not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: Well, first off, my cat simply doesn't use it. But cats are finicky, so I can't fault the product for that. He played with the marbles for a few days before losing interest. Most importantly, when he went to use the scratching post, the narrow base wobbled too much and scared him off. I don't think this is suitable as a scratching post for anything but the smallest of cats. It's probably a fine product, but my cat doesn't like it. He prefers his cardboard lounger (or, unfortunately, still the corner of my sofa).
customer_reviews.author: T.C.

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and another scratching post which both came today. The cats have not left this one and they've both been up for a few hours. This one is my favorite because of the marbles in the grooves in the base. Nothing can usually keep a cat's attention for more than a couple of minutes, but our two kitties are enamored with those marbles. The marbles can't come out, but they bat at them or push them a little with their paws to make them move around. I will definitely buy this cat scratching post again when I need a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie NelsonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My three adult cats were drawn to it
customer_reviews.text: I'm on a 10 acre plot with three mostly-outside barn cats that control the local critter population. We let them in when the weather is bad and they have to be watched carefully as they would tend to scratch furniture. I bought this as a diversion from that and surprised to find that all three were immediately attracted to it. One minor improvement I'll make is to screw it to a couple 2x4s to extend the base and make it heavier, as adult cats tend to move it around a bit. All in all, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B

customer_reviews.title: We like it, but our cats don’t!
customer_reviews.text: It is great! We really like it! But unfortunately, so far our two cats are not impressed. One is three, and the other two. We were hoping it would stop the younger cat from clawing our furniture and rug. But he just walks by it, and played with the marbles a little. So time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: No base support
customer_reviews.text: This would be great if it weren’t for the very light wood base. Constantly finding this thing knocked over because it has no base wight to support the cats scratching. And the marble toy in the bottom is fun for some of my cats but very loud. Was concerned the first time I heard it and finally realized it was this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Majed

customer_reviews.title: An OK product.
customer_reviews.text: I have a suggestion for this product. The ball came off immediately. What about having a stick or wired about 12' long that can be inserted in the top with the ball on top of that. In that way the kitties have something challenging to climb for rather than something to break right away. My one kitten did not like the jute- likes my carpet better so next time I will buy one with carpet rather than jute.. They loved the marbles for the first week or so then got bored.
customer_reviews.author: MG  Z

customer_reviews.title: fun for everyone
customer_reviews.text: my cat loves this toy. he needed a new scratcher so i ordered this one without noticing the marble track im glad i didnt i would have missed out. the scratcher is great easy to assemble a bit short but thats ok the real feature though is the marble track in the base. he goes nuts over it batting the marbles around trying to catch them its funny and cute and since they cant leave the track no worries about steping on one. the only negative things i can say about it is its light and easily tipable by a larger cat and the noise of the marble track but the fun is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: A fun new scratcher for my cat!
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say this is a cool new scratcher toy! The instructions and assembly are super easy. The heavy bottom and anti slip pads (included) make it hard for my cat to tip over. Good heavy roping for scratching. Cat teaser hangs off top for extra fun. For double the fun the bottom part has some marbles in two circle mazes that my cat can push around. The only thing I might change would be to elevate the marbles a bit more like a rollerball so that bigger cats like mine could push the marbles easier. Overall... My cat loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Amy L. Murtha

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our Kitten in every way
customer_reviews.text: Just adopted a seven week old kitty and this is perfect for honing her skills and claws. She played with it immediately and every day since. The balls do not come out and she caught on how to get them rolling as soon as we put it down. This post Is great for climbing and then hanging from top to play with the ball! The ball can be reached from bottom also. It seems to be really sturdy so far. Assembly takes a minute. Only tool required is supplied. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Della Reeves-Burckhardt

customer_reviews.title: Happy kitten
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add a scratching post to the living room for our new kitten. Seems very sturdy and durable. Two things I don’t like about it are the toy on top is actually attached to the side and the marbles are fully recessed in the base. I would prefer the toy attached to the top so it could bounce around the entire tower rather than one side. The marbles are tough to roll around. It hasn’t been a problem for my kitten but I figure as he grows he won’t. E able to reach his laws in quite the same to push them around.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Cats are enjoying this a lot
customer_reviews.text: This scratching post replaced a previous one that didn’t have the toys this one does. My two cats have made the transition perfectly and enjoy the post itself, the marbles in the base they can push around, and the post itself. While we still need to trim there nails each week, the post helps to reduce the amount of scratching they try to do to our furniture. The height of the post itself is about 2 feet so doesn’t stick out in the room as much as the old one did. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Base is too lightweight for large cats
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to assemble, and my cats are fascinated by the marble at the bottom. However, my cats are pretty large (15+lbs) and they do not like scratching on the post because it starts to tip over. The base is too lightweight to handle their aggressive scratching, and they haven't used it since the second day.
customer_reviews.author: MrsMeow

customer_reviews.title: It’s a hit,
customer_reviews.text: My two six-month-old kittens took to this immediately. They are very entertained by the marbles. We have two older scratching posts; one they ignore; the other one tips over very easily. This has not tipped yet-it’s very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mawood

customer_reviews.title: Our cat loves this scratching post
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this scratching post with toy at the bottom. She spins the marbles around throughout the day and especially early mornings. She’s finicky so happy I found something that she loves. She uses the scratching post throughout each day, too. It’s small enough so it doesn’t take up a lot of space but it’s sturdy enough to take her playful pouncing. Was extremely easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Alynnclark

customer_reviews.title: Fun for my kitty while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this for the 3 weeks it lasted. Then my 3 lb kitty attacked it one time too many, I guess? At first, I thought it came unscrewed from the base. But then I realized the tube is just card board and it became detached from the piece that attaches to the base. It had staples sticking out. Super disappointing since it had such great reviews and my kitty had so much fun with it. Maybe I just received a defective one?
customer_reviews.author: D324

customer_reviews.title: We got it as a distraction for kitty so she wouldn’t tear up the furniture.
customer_reviews.text: Our kitty likes this scratching post, but she liked it laying down so she can bat the Pom Pom on the top around, silly cat, not how it was intended to be played with, but it’s her toy. Super easy to put together, arrived fast. We got new furniture so we got this for the kitty as a distraction so she wouldn’t scratch up the furniture, seems to be working.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D

customer_reviews.title: Cats use it often
customer_reviews.text: Our two very playful cats use this post often -- although not exclusively. They still will sharpen their claws on rugs and furniture in passing, but they don't damage anything, perhaps because they do have this proper scratching post. They also play with the ball bearings in the inventive stand as well. Every house with cats needs a scratching post, and this is a good, sturdy one.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Ann Sherman

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best scratching pole and toy I have found for my cat. It's very sturdy and the base quite heavy. My cat can still tip it over but I noticed that he is careful how he uses it so as not to tip it over! Interesting. One night I heard this funny whirring sound and discovered it was him in the living room spinning the balls round and around. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scratching post, great materials.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for a small kitten to be trained. It was easy to assemble, and the kitten took to it right away. The only downfall is the base it's not large enough to handle a larger cat, the marbles perplexed her at first, but a little parenting showed her how the marbles work and she spent hours chasing the marbles. A simple fix to the base would be getting a larger plywood base and simply screwing it to the existing base allowing for a larger base and a larger cat.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Wallbanger

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t come with hardware as it claims
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble my ass. This didn’t come with the screws or wrench thingy like it claims it does. Literally USELESS without it.
customer_reviews.author: Sale@theCrabCrib

customer_reviews.title: could be better
customer_reviews.text: The cats love it & the marbles in the tracks. However, the lower half of the post has already been destroyed from their scratching. It's not very durable like a carpet. It's more of a felt material that they can destroy quickly. They don't much like the rope upper half of the post.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Olson

customer_reviews.title: ... 2nd one will suffice!
customer_reviews.text: 1st was a joke, missing parts, poorly assembled with staples sticking out and gaps between the rope and the carpet, patterns not lined up. 2nd one will suffice. Base unsteady, full non-skid surface on base would be beneficial, not four non-functional squares included. Quality workmanship, safety to pets, & longevity make a company shoppable. (Appreciated the replacement)!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems shorter than advertised...
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought for my biggest cat who is about 12 lbs...and come to find out, when she stretches, she is taller than this post. So, gave it to my baby who is 7 and is about 8 lbs., and she loves it! Her little paws fit in the circles so she can play with marbles and she wraps herself around this post, kicking and scratching. Holds well. I have it on a rug and it does not slide around...due to wooden bottom, looks like it may if not on a rug...
customer_reviews.author: srggg3

customer_reviews.title: Saves the Furniture!
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES his new scratching post. He’s had a few throughout his four years of life, but this one has by far the most features. The different textures provide different sensations for his claws, and the tuft of fur at the top provides entertainment. But by far the favorite feature of this post are the marble tracks on the base - as he scratches, the marbles race around and stimulate the senses. Overall, solid product.
customer_reviews.author: LaFawnDuh

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: My cats don't have much interest in this but that isn't the products fault. I can't say too much about how it holds up since my cats don't use it much but I will say that the edges are WAY too sharp. I've relocated it several times just to keep it away from my path because it HURTS to scrape your foot across. I don't know if I received a faulty one and they're supposed to be softer edges but if this is going to be anywhere there's foot traffic, I would pass on buying it. Not sure if the sharp edges have anything to do with my cats not enjoying it though.
customer_reviews.author: jrik

customer_reviews.title: My cats like it.
customer_reviews.text: My two cats are brothers with very different personalities. They both like this cat scratcher and Ruby (yes, he is a boy-cat) actually plays with the little marbles on the base. Jasper ignores them, so here we go. Like most things, the scratcher is only good if the cats use it. Mine do and seem to like it right away. I switched to taller scratchers for my cats as I read that is beneficial for their bodies to stretch while scratching. It's sturdy enough and the sizeable base is stable for 16lb Ruby and 12lb Jasper.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a long time before I found this cat scratcher... I am mostly pleased as it is attractive and functional but didn't hold up very well (or for very long) against my cat's scratches - the non twine part is destroyed and gets all over my house. Would give it 5 stars if the entire post was twine or another, more durable material.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica D.

customer_reviews.title: Not that sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My large cat easily knocked it to almost fall, then bounced back that it hit him. He is scared of it now and I am returning this item. It is not sturdy as advertised. Thankfully it has free return so I am happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: S.Etank

customer_reviews.title: Psycho cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: Great post, easy to put together and my cat knew immediately that this was for him to Scratch. The only downside was the base arrived with dark smudges on it but we don’t really care so we’re keeping it. It seems like a porous surface that would get dirty easily anyway. Plus we can’t go without a scratching post because this crazy psycho cat will eat my plants or scratch my furniture instead.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Dahl

customer_reviews.title: portability is perrrfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have a wonderful cat tree that the kittens love, but it is downstairs and I really don't need another cat tree upstairs. This scratching post is so great because the cats like to follow me from room to room where I work, and they always have a scratching post because it can easily move it. Best of all, they love the marbles at the bottom and almost spend more time on that rather than scratching or playing with the ball on top. It has kept them entertained and kept them from scratching my furniture - love it!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Better than any other scratcher!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this scratching post and then saw one at Bed Bath and Beyond for $10 less. When this one arrived, I was soo pleased. This scratcher, I mean ball maze is the best thing for my little kitten. She's spending hours playing with the balls and also loves to stretch to the top of the tower. It's very sturdy and will be forever my cat's favorite toy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Williams

customer_reviews.title: Marbles are a hit
customer_reviews.text: This is 30 seconds after assembly which took 2 minutes. They love the marbles. It's very small for my cats to use as a scratcher. Will not return it because they love the marbles. Also, these scratchers need the pole on one side not the middle so you place against something for safety and easy use.
customer_reviews.author: ladyesmiles

customer_reviews.title: Apology
customer_reviews.text: I wrote an earlier review when I could not complete the assembly of this little cat scratcher. But I was wrong. When I saw a series of photos assembling the scratcher, it could see what I did not see before. It is a great cat scratcher at a very reasonable price. I would definitely recommend it. Diane Livinston
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Diane Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: My cats are constantly knocking this over, plus one got a nasty cut playing with the marbles. DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and our cat likes it!
customer_reviews.text: This cat scratching pole is great! It’s about the height of our cat fully extended but she enjoys scratching on it. It took about 6 months before she started playing with the marbles at the bottom but now that she’s discovered them she plays with them all the time (see video). As you can see, it’s still in great condition even though we’ve had it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and fun!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this! It's very sturdy and the addition of a toy at the base is an added bonus. The post itself uses two different fabrics, which keeps my cat interested, as does the toy. The only thing to keep in mind is that the post is short, so if you have a big cat, this may be too small. Great for a playful little one, tho.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kitten scratch post!
customer_reviews.text: My kitten “Star” loves the ball berrings in the base - loves to make them go around. Has jute rope on post for scratching and nice quality soft rug material which she loves. Teather ball coming from top. Great choice. Very sturdy and easily put it together with wrench that was provided for one screw.
customer_reviews.author: BARBARA STUFF

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed with the base being so light.
customer_reviews.text: My cat has no interest in this. She tried and yanked at it once, and it tipped over, she is NOT a big cat, but is a scratcher. I had to weigh the base down so it's sturdy. She is intrigued by the marbles and ball on top, but that's it. She don't scratch it. Good for kitten. My Walla is only 4 yrs and not THAT strong. Could use better, more sturdy base.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D. Flack

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it!(:
customer_reviews.text: Got new couches, so of course I didn’t want my kitten to make them his new sharpening toy. Got this for him, and he loves it. This is his first scratch post, and so I had to spray it with catnip for him to get an idea what it’s for. Assembly was easy, I didn’t need to use a guide, and it keeps its weight too
customer_reviews.author: Brookfield

customer_reviews.title: This is cool but not if your cat is clever...!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 3 months! MY CAT LOVES it! More like he is obsessed with it. But, be aware that your cat is trying to get the balls out of the toy. So, you WILL lose all the balls. They are not, too, sturdy and easily break. And honestly, it is the only reason my 6 month old kitty uses the toy.
customer_reviews.author: Shirleydor_

customer_reviews.title: Well built...but can not get my cat interested
customer_reviews.text: This is hard to review. It arrived fast and was very easy to build. However, no matter what I do, my cat wont get interested in it. I even spent an extra $20 to get cat nip spray to attract him to it. He still wont touch. I gave him the box the package came in, and he plays with it every day. I honestly don't know if i should return or not; I don't want to give the box back....lol
customer_reviews.author: Stamina4Days

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cats for more toys! They love it! The little marble at bottom and use it for scratching a lot! Easy to put together too just twist the pole into the board with marble on bottom no tools just bam done and they can play! It’s held up great too!
customer_reviews.author: Missy!

customer_reviews.title: Not so great for adult cat
customer_reviews.text: My Kittie couldn’t wait for me to put it together. She immediately went to use it and it did not stay upright. She’s used it maybe twice. She’s more interested in the marbles. Wish it was more stable. Update: I moved it to a place where she was scratching on the cabinets and she is using it more instead of the cabinets😁
customer_reviews.author: Alice hughes

customer_reviews.title: Cat Scratcher
customer_reviews.text: The picture is deceiving. I usually do not buy under 36" and I did not read the discription (my mistake). It is shorter than what my cats like - good for kittens. The plus is that my one cat loves the marbles on the bottom of the pole base. Got on sale so was a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Karin

customer_reviews.title: A little lightweight for scratching
customer_reviews.text: The marbles in the base are fun and the cats are so irked they can't get them out. However, when they go to scratch the top, the base is so light that it begins to topple and scares them.
customer_reviews.author: Allison N Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Big hit
customer_reviews.text: My kittens loved this. The marbles in the base were a real surprise - they play with those all the time. I didn't even realize they were in the base. Both kitten dive bomb and climb this and it hasn't turned over at all. Easy to assemble. Nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Northern Colorado DIY

customer_reviews.title: My cat votes YES!
customer_reviews.text: My new cat fell in love with the toy the moment she started pushing to balls around! I've never seen her so active and happy even when playing with her toy mouse with Kat nip in it!! I love the toy too since it makes my little girl happy.
customer_reviews.author: mark debrizzi

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble and my kitties love it. I added catnip on top of the pole too. It comes with rubber stickers for every corner on the bottom back of the base, so even when kitty scratches pole, it won’t move. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Teacake

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Received my big kitties new scratching post, it was super easy to put together the tools were included! My old cat loves it! It’s tall, the material used she prefers over the just carpet ones and the balls on the base keep her very entertained. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Tompkins

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves the multiple uses of this post! We've had this a couple days and he almost has the ball ripped off the string- which will be very disappointing when that's gone since he loves it so much. But that's life with cats. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Eva_NewLife

customer_reviews.title: Small but AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4mo kitten at home and she absolutely LOVES THIS. Her favorite part is the marbles, that are big enough to not get eaten. My only fear is with enough scratching at them, the marbles can slip out. It is very small as the other reviews said, but it's about 2 feet tall. Its pretty easy to assemble, and the seller provides tools to set it up. It took me less than 2 minutes to do so. A great gift for any cat!
customer_reviews.author: luis

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly happy kitten
customer_reviews.text: My kitten is finally using this post. She seems to love batting the pom-pom and scratching on both the carpet and sisal rope surfaces. She's fascinated with the movement of the marbles in the base, but so far hasn't engaged in moving the marbles by herself. All in all, excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes this
customer_reviews.text: I had just gotten a kitten and was not sure how he would like it but he uses it daily.
customer_reviews.author: C. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Easily destroyed
customer_reviews.text: My cat knocks it over almost every time she tries to claw at it. The fluffy ball that's attached by a bungee lasts about a week, this is my second unit that I bought. The marbles are the only thing that will last a long time
customer_reviews.author: Mugsy

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product - it is dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This product can injure your cat and needs an immediate fix for safety reasons. The grooves in the base (for the marbles) are too large. My 10 week-old kitten got his hind leg stuck in the groove and twisted it while playing, making the loudest yelp I've ever heard out of a cat, and now has a sprained back leg. It would be so easy to make the grooves/marble tracks smaller so that limbs cannot fit into grooves, causing potential injury during play. Total no-brainer and big unfortunate oversight. Do not buy this product until the design is fixed or you'll injure your cat and end up in the ER. I am returning the product.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Darrow

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My kitten loves this and I just got it two days ago. To be fair, my kitten is extra crazy so he will jump on it at full speed and it may wobble a little. He loves it though. I will say that it is small and once he is full grown I may have to get something bigger. Super easy to assembly though and very stimulating for a kitten
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: This scratching post arrived on time, was packed purfectly ( pun intended) and was super easy to assemble. My cat loves it and I’m so happy she is using it instead of my chairs and sofa. I’m very pleased with it! The seller contacted me to make sure the post had arrived in good condition and that I was pleased with the product. I love dealing with sellers who care about customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl G

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: My kitten is 5 months old. I've only had him a month. I've have 3 different type scratchers that he isn't learning to use.. So I thought I'd give this a try.. He ignored it until I laid treats on the very top and the swinging ball. It didn't take long..now he plays and scratches on it constantly.. Great choice. Great buy. It's saving my furniture.
customer_reviews.author: A.John Weberpal

customer_reviews.title: Our Cats Adore This!
customer_reviews.text: We seldom order any product that we’d have to assemble ourselves. This one took very little time! Our cats were so amazed when they first saw it. And now they thoroughly enjoy all the activities available with it. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: ol'hippiepeacenik

customer_reviews.title: Rowdy Kitten Approved
customer_reviews.text: Awesome scratching post. The ball bearings are a big hit for Leo. He loves getting them rolling in opposite directions as fast as he can. He loves the sound as they roll around and round. Am buying a second one. 🐈🐾🐾🐾🐾🐾🐾
customer_reviews.author: MZ

customer_reviews.title: Cat knows it's for him!
customer_reviews.text: It took 2 days or so for him to warm up to it but now he knows it belongs to him. He doesn't even notice the marbles u less I push then around. He enjoys biting the puff ball attached. My cat is older and about 12lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Multi-Use!!
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves the marbles actually the most! Great nice durable scratch post!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Mirza Janczy

customer_reviews.title: Cat didn’t use the post
customer_reviews.text: My cat liked the marble rolling feature at the base of the post but she didn’t care for the scratch post itself. I’ve been on the lookout for a scratch post that my picky cat will finally use instead of the sides of my bed, but I guess the search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great Post!
customer_reviews.text: My girls both love it! We were wary to replace our old carpet post but our girls both flocked to the new post like they knew it was coming. They play with the dangly ball as well as the marbles on the bottom and scratch the sisal rope at the top. If your cats need a little activity, I definitely recommend this post. Came the next day, too! Can’t beat that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tips over too easy.
customer_reviews.text: The scrathing post is made well, but the base is too light. My cat easily pulls the scratching post down when trying to use it. After the first few attempts he learned it doesn’t stay upright and lost interest. I’ve temporally placed two 5lb weights on the base to keep it from being pulled over. I keep it against a wall, weights by the wall. My cat actually uses it now.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.S.

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this!
customer_reviews.text: So my cat loves this one very nice couch in our living room because she thinks it makes an awesome scratching post. I placed this near the couch corner she scratches and she now goes for the post, not the couch. She also loves to bat at the little toy at the top. Very pleased! Very sturdy scratching post. This is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: If your cat is to big it tips over.
customer_reviews.text: My one dislike is that it tips over easy. My cat is on the small size for sure, scares her to death. She loves to scratch on it for sure. Going to put a larger piece of wood and attach it to that.
customer_reviews.author: Donna  Denmon

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Love This!
customer_reviews.text: They are fascinated with the marble ball toy. My cats won't touch the cardboard scratchers that sit on the floor, even with catnip, but they took to this one right away because of the marble toy and pom-pom and then it took them another day or so to go after the sisal. It seems to be made well and it was easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I recently adopted a 12 week old kitten. He is crazy about this. He sleeps next to me and when we get up the first thing he does every single day is attack the post. It makes me happy to watch him play so enthusiastically.
customer_reviews.author: Buz from Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful interactive unit that takes up minimal space!
customer_reviews.text: it was super simple to assemble! there are various engaging activities in one simple unit! kitties immediately began using it! (the marbles in the base required I move them some for the kitties to realize they were there, now they chase them often!)
customer_reviews.author: Amancay Blank

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy when my cat is scratching.
customer_reviews.text: It working out quite well . I hope my cat becomes more interested in the marbles and can amuse herself better. She loves the hanging toy but unfortunately, it did not last as she chews the stretchy cord. But she now plays soccer with the ball on the top
customer_reviews.author: suyeta

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My cat hates this thing. It isn't very heavy so when she leans on it to sharpen her nails, it falls over. If they improve this, it will be a good product because the material is good and the marbles feature is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Thorburn

customer_reviews.title: shorter than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: The marbles in the stand are super cute, but the post is smaller around and shorter than I anticipated. I've yet to see if my cats will use it as it is too short for them to stand up and stretch.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa White

customer_reviews.title: Missing 2 parts, but excited to use it!
customer_reviews.text: I think it will be great, but it was missing 2 parts and so now I have to find a screw the right size (which is a pain at this point in time with stay-at-home order). I can't wait to use it/show my cat, but now I have to wait even longer and I was a disappointed that all the parts weren't there.
customer_reviews.author: Coquette

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together but it wasn’t very sturdy. I tightened the screws as best I could but it was no use. Lastly, the little ball came off almost immediately and all I have is a kitten lol.
customer_reviews.author: Saki

customer_reviews.title: For smaller kittens but if mounted can entertain cats of all ages
customer_reviews.text: My kittens are bigger now, they are almost cats so they do knock it over, but they wouldn't if they were younger. We have mounted it to a bigger piece of plywood and they can use it for awhile longer! They love it!
customer_reviews.author: Charlina

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this post??? I have no idea why. They've turned their nose up at some many other ones. So far they haven't managed to knock it over, they are about 9 pounds each and a year old.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: LOADS OF FUN FOR YOUR KITTY
customer_reviews.text: Well, I think it’s safe to say this kitty likes it a lot! This is immediately after I EASILY put it together. Although, he was trying to play with it while I was screwing things together. A very FUN, clever idea with the marble base too! A well thought and worth every penny for a scratching post!! Highly recommended!! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.author: G. Hogarth

product_meta.title: 4 Paws Stuff Tall Cat Scratching Post Cat Interactive Toys - Cat Scratch Post Cats Kittens - Plush Sisal Scratch Pole Cat Scratcher - 22 inches (Beige)
product_meta.description:
Color:Beige"Are you a cat owner who tired of scratches on your furniture and carpets?
Want to give your kitty something better to scratch?
Looking for ultimate scratching post to keep your kitten entertained?
Here is 4PawsStuff sisal scratching post, that will meet your needs and will become your pet's favorite interactive toy
""Why this cat scratch post tree?"", you may ask

FOUR REASONS FOR CHOOSING 4PawsStuff CAT CARPET SCRATCHING POST

√ VARIOUS INTERACTIVE TOYS
Two tracks with spinning balls on the base of the cat scratch post will keep your kitten occupied, stimulated and happy
Securely attached to the top of the 22-inch vertical cat scratcher post plush ball will be attractive for older cats
Whether it a kitten or a senior cat, your pet will be engaged for hours!

√ STURDY & STABLE CONSTRUCTION
Sisal pole has 11,6""х11,6"" thick MDF base - to prevent it from knocking over
FREE velcros will ensure additional stability of the kitten scratch post and will serve for the floor protection

√ SAFE, HIGH-QUALITY MATERIALS
Vertical post of the big scratching pole for cats is wrapped in twisted sisal rope and soft-to-touch but tough to tear plush
Let your cat leave the furniture alone and enjoy scratching natural, non-toxic materials of the cat scratch pole!

√ EASY ASSEMBLE
All you need is to screw two parts of post together and then screw into the base. L-shaped wrench and screw are in the package

PLEASE BE PATIENT
It may take some time to encourage your cat to interest with vertical scratch post

Do you want to keep your cats from destroying furniture but at the same time to give them a way to satisfy natural instinct to scratch?
So go ahead; CLICK [Add to Cart] and get the best scratching post NOW, it's totally risk-free with our ONE-YEAR guarantee!".
feature_bullets: EFFECTIVE WAY TO KEEP YOUR CAT FROM SCRATCHING FURNITURE - cat scratch post tree will serve as a fun playground for pets and at the same time as their own scratching space
A LOT OF FUN ACTIVITIES - cat sisal scratching post is designed with two different captivating toys that will entertain your kitty whether it is a kitten or a senior cat
NATURAL MATERIALS - the 22-inch cats scratching post tree is wrapped in sisal rope and plush - eco-friendly materials of the cat tree are absolutely safe for both people and pets
STABLE BASE of the sisal pole for cats is made of thick pressed wood which provides reliability and stability of construction; FREE velcros will help to prevent spoiling the floor
EASY TO SET UP - cat scratching posts require minimum assembling efforts; just screw all parts together, and kitten scratching post is ready to use (screws included).
